{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents describe the blood supply of the scaphoid bone. According to the information, the blood supply is from proximal to distal, which means that the distal pole of the scaphoid does not receive direct blood supply from its own proximal part. This suggests that if there is a fracture in the scaphoid, the distal pole may be at risk of avascular necrosis due to disruption of this blood supply.", "answer_choice": "A"}
